Detailed Description

template<typename ValueType, typename ConstraintPolicy = boost::function1<bool, const ValueType &>, typename ErrorPolicy = throw_exception<>>
class boost::constrained_value::constrained< ValueType, ConstraintPolicy, ErrorPolicy >

Template of constrained object classes.

This class is a wrapper for value_type. Objects of this class can be used just like objects of value_type, with one exception: they can be given only a value which conforms to the specified constraint.

Parameters:
ValueType The underlying value type.
ConstraintPolicy Type of UnaryPredicate determining whether a value is constraint-conforming. If it is a function objects class, it must have const invocation operator.
ErrorPolicy Type of ternary function called when an attempt is made to assign a non-constraint-conforming value to a constrained object. The arguments passed are (in order):
  • the underlying value_type mutable object (its value may be non-constraint-conforming if the policy is called during initialization of a constrained object with such value),
  • the new value_type immutable object with non-constraint-conforming value,
  • the underlying constraint_type mutable object.
If the function returns, it should modify the underlying value or the constraint so that the value is constraint-conforming after the call. If it fails to do so, BOOST_ASSERT is invoked.
Invariant:
constraint()(value())
Remarks:
  • Provides implicitly-declared special member functions apart from default constructor, but only when all the template actual parameters provide the corresponding functions too.
  • Is implicitly Convertible to/from value_type.

Definition at line 127 of file constrained.hpp.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

constrained (  ) 

The default constructor.

If the value-initialized value_type object is not constraint-conforming according to the default-initialized constraint_type object, the default-initialized error_handler_type object is called.

Remarks:
  • All the constrained template actual parameters must be DefaultConstructible.
  • Neither constraint_type nor error_handler_type can be a non-empty POD type.

Definition at line 179 of file constrained.hpp.

constrained ( const constrained< V, C, E > &  other  )  [explicit]

Constructor initializing all the underlying objects with the corresponding objects of other.

Initializes all the underlying objects with the corresponding objects of other. Then, if the value_type object is not constraint-conforming according to the constraint_type object, the error_handler_type object is called.

This constructor helps to avoid confusing situations when object of different constrained template class would be used as initializer, but only the value would be copied (since constrained is implicitly convertible to value_type).

Remarks:
  • All the actual parameters of the constructor template must be Convertible to the corresponding actual parameters of the containing class template.
  • All the containing class template actual parameters must be CopyConstructible.

Definition at line 209 of file constrained.hpp.

constrained ( const value_type &  v  ) 

Constructor converting implicitly from value_type.

If the copy of v is not constraint-conforming according to the default-initialized constraint_type object, the default-initialized error_handler_type object is called.

Remarks:
  • value_type must be CopyConstructible.
  • constraint_type and error_handler_type must be DefaultConstructible.
  • Neither constraint_type nor error_handler_type can be a non-empty POD type.

Definition at line 222 of file constrained.hpp.

constrained ( const constraint_type &  c  )  [explicit]

Constructor initializing the constraint with the given object.

If the value-initialized value_type object is not constraint-conforming according to the copy of c, the default-initialized error_handler_type object is called.

Remarks:
  • constraint_type must be CopyConstructible.
  • value_type and error_handler_type must be DefaultConstructible.
  • error_handler_type cannot be a non-empty POD type.

Definition at line 235 of file constrained.hpp.

constrained ( const error_handler_type &  e  )  [explicit]

Constructor initializing the error handler with the given object.

If the value-initialized value_type object is not constraint-conforming according to the default-initialized constraint_type object, the copy of e is called.

Remarks:
  • error_handler_type must be CopyConstructible.
  • value_type and constraint_type must be DefaultConstructible.
  • constraint_type cannot be a non-empty POD type.

Definition at line 248 of file constrained.hpp.

constrained ( const value_type &  v,
const constraint_type &  c 
)

Constructor initializing the value and the constraint with the given objects.

If the copy of v is not constraint-conforming according to the copy of c, the default-initialized error_handler_type object is called.

Remarks:
  • value_type and constraint_type must be CopyConstructible.
  • error_handler_type must be DefaultConstructible.
  • error_handler_type cannot be a non-empty POD type.

Remarks:

  • constraint_type must be DefaultConstructible.
  • constraint_type cannot be a non-empty POD type.

Definition at line 187 of file constrained.hpp.

constrained& operator= ( const constrained< V, C, E > &  other  ) 

Assignment operator for objects of different constrained template classes.

Constructs a temporary object of the containing class initializing it with other, and then swaps the object with *this.

This operator helps to avoid confusing situations when object of different constrained template class would be assigned, but only the value would be copied (since constrained is implicitly convertible to value_type).

Returns:
*this
Remarks:
  • All the actual parameters of the constructor template must be Convertible to the corresponding actual parameters of the containing class template.
  • All the containing class template actual parameters must be CopyConstructible and Swappable.

Definition at line 320 of file constrained.hpp.

constrained& operator= ( const value_type &  v  ) 

Assignment operator for value_type objects.

If v is constraint-conforming, it is assigned to the underlying value_type object. Otherwise the error handler is called.

Returns:
*this
Remarks:
value_type must be Assignable.

Definition at line 476 of file constrained.hpp.

void change_constraint ( constrained< V, C, E > &  c,
const T &  new_constraint 
) [related]

Changes the constraint of the given constrained object.

Creates a new object with the value and error handler of c, but with new_constraint as its constraint, and swaps the object with c.

Note, that using this function is reasonable only when C objects have some internal state.

Remarks:
  • T must be Convertible to C.
  • V, C and E must be CopyConstructible and Swappable.

+= operator for constrained and T.

Definition at line 600 of file constrained.hpp.

std::basic_istream< Ch, Tr > & operator>> ( std::basic_istream< Ch, Tr > &  is,
constrained< V, C, E > &  c 
) [related]

Stream extraction operator for constrained.

Creates a variable that is a copy of the value of c and calls stream extraction operator for the variable using is. If this succeeds, assigns the variable to c.

Note, that this operator reads only the underlying value from the stream, but not the constraint nor the error policy.

Returns:
is
Remarks:
  • V must be InputStreamable and CopyConstructible.
  • This function template is not defined if BOOST_NO_IOSFWD macro is defined.

Definition at line 628 of file constrained.hpp.

std::basic_ostream< Ch, Tr > & operator<< ( std::basic_ostream< Ch, Tr > &  os,
const constrained< V, C, E > &  c 
) [related]

Stream insertion operator for constrained.

Outputs the value of c to os.

Note, that this operator writes only the underlying value to the stream, but not the constraint nor the error policy.

Returns:
os
Remarks:
  • V must be OutputStreamable.
  • This function template is not defined if BOOST_NO_IOSFWD macro is defined.
